text: Anthony Edgar "Tony" Sale, FBCS (30 January 1931 â€“ 28 August 2011) was an English electronic engineer, computer programmer, computer hardware engineer, and historian of computing. He helped create the Colossus computer replica at The National Museum of Computing at Bletchley Park in England.Mark Ward, 12 July 2007. "The past is the future at Bletchley Park", BBC News, Retrieved 3 August 2009 It was completed in 2007. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2011 deaths Category:British computer engineers Category:Historians from London Category:Scientists from London
